question_text: Which of the following are in inverse proportion? (i) The number of workers on a job and the time to complete the job. (ii) The time taken for a journey and the distance travelled at a uniform speed. (iii) The area of cultivated land and the crop harvested. (iv) The time taken for a fixed journey and the speed of the vehicle. (v) The population of a country and the area of land per person.
explanation: To decide whether two quantities vary inversely, we check if their product remains constant. For (i), as the number of workers increases, the time taken (for a fixed job) decreases; hence they are inversely proportional. For (ii), if speed is constant then time is directly related to distance traveled. In (iii), more area generally leads to more crop harvested (direct relation) and for (iv), a higher speed for a fixed journey implies less time, an inverse relation. In (v), if the population increases, the land available per person decreases, showing an inverse relationship.

question_text: In a Television game show, the prize money of ₹1,00,000 is to be divided equally amongst the winners. Complete the following table and determine whether the prize money given to an individual winner is directly or inversely proportional to the number of winners.
correct_answer: The prize money per winner is inversely proportional to the number of winners.
explanation: Since the total prize money is fixed at ₹1,00,000, the amount each winner receives is calculated as (Total Prize Money ÷ Number of Winners). This shows an inverse relation: as the number of winners increases, the share per winner decreases proportionately.

question_text:
Rehman is making a wheel using spokes. He wants to fix equal spokes such that the angles between any pair of consecutive spokes are equal. Given the table: 

Number of spokes: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12
Angle between consecutive spokes: 90°, 60°, 45°, 36°, 30°

(i) Are the number of spokes and the angles between consecutive spokes in inverse proportion?
(ii) Calculate the angle between a pair of consecutive spokes on a wheel with 15 spokes.
(iii) How many spokes would be needed if the angle between a pair of consecutive spokes is 40°?
explanation: The full angle around a point is 360°. (i) Since the angle is given by 360° divided by the number of spokes, as the number of spokes increases, the angle decreases, meaning they are inversely proportional. (ii) For a wheel with 15 spokes, the angle = 360° ÷ 15 = 24°. (iii) If the angle is 40°, then the number of spokes needed is 360° ÷ 40° = 9.

question_text: If a box of sweets is divided among 24 children, they will get 5 sweets each. How many sweets would each child get if the number of children is reduced by 4?
explanation: Total number of sweets = 24 × 5 = 120 sweets. With 4 fewer children, there will be 20 children. Each child would then get 120 ÷ 20 = 6 sweets.

question_text: A farmer has enough food to feed 20 animals for 6 days. How long would the food last if there were 10 more animals?
explanation: Total food available can be measured in animal-days: 20 animals × 6 days = 120 animal-days. If the number of animals increases to 30, the food will last for 120 ÷ 30 = 4 days.

question_text: A contractor estimates that 3 persons could rewire a house in 4 days. If he uses 4 persons instead, how long should they take to complete the job?
explanation: Total work measured in person-days is 3 × 4 = 12 person-days. With 4 persons, the time required = 12 ÷ 4 = 3 days.

question_text: A batch of bottles was packed in 25 boxes with 12 bottles in each box. If the same batch is packed using 20 bottles in each box, how many boxes would be filled?
explanation: Total bottles in the batch = 25 × 12 = 300. Packing 20 bottles per box gives the number of boxes = 300 ÷ 20 = 15 boxes.

question_text: A factory requires 42 machines to produce a given number of articles in 63 days. How many machines would be required to produce the same number of articles in 54 days?
explanation: Total machine-days needed = 42 × 63 = 2646. To produce the same output in 54 days, the number of machines required = 2646 ÷ 54 = 49.

question_text: A car takes 2 hours to reach a destination by travelling at a speed of 60 km/h. How long will it take when the car travels at a speed of 80 km/h?
explanation: The distance covered = Speed × Time = 60 km/h × 2 h = 120 km. At 80 km/h, time taken = 120 km ÷ 80 km/h = 1.5 hours.

question_text:
Two persons could fit new windows in a house in 3 days.
(i) If one of the persons fell ill before the work started, how long would the job take?
(ii) How many persons would be needed to fit the windows in one day?
explanation: Total work = 2 persons × 3 days = 6 person-days. (i) With one person working, time required = 6 person-days ÷ 1 = 6 days. (ii) To complete the work in 1 day, the number of persons required = 6 person-days ÷ 1 day = 6 persons.

question_text: A school has 8 periods a day, each of 45 minutes duration. How long would each period be if the school has 9 periods a day, assuming the total school hours remain the same?
explanation: Total duration of school hours = 8 × 45 = 360 minutes. With 9 periods, the duration of each period = 360 ÷ 9 = 40 minutes.

question_text:
DO THIS Activity 1: Take a sheet of paper and fold it as shown in the figure. Count the number of parts and determine the area of a part in each case. Tabulate your observations and discuss whether it is a case of inverse proportion.

For example:
• 1 part → area of the paper
• 2 parts → each has ½ the area of the paper
• 4 parts → each has ¼ the area of the paper
• 8 parts → each has 1/8 the area of the paper
• 16 parts → each has 1/16 the area of the paper
correct_answer: Yes, it is a case of inverse proportion because the product of the number of parts and the area of each part remains equal to the area of the paper (which is constant).
explanation: When you fold the paper, you are dividing the total area into a number of equal parts. If A is the total area, and n is the number of parts, then the area of each part = A/n. Since A is constant, the number of parts and the area of each part are inversely proportional (n × (A/n) = A).

question_text:
DO THIS Activity 2: Take a few containers of different sizes with circular bases. Fill each container with the same amount of water. Note the diameter of each container and the respective height at which the water level stands. Tabulate your observations and determine whether this is a case of inverse proportion.

Hint: For a cylinder, the volume V = (πd²/4) × h, so if V is constant, then h ∝ 1/d².
correct_answer: Yes, approximately. Since the volume of water is constant, the height of the water in each container is inversely proportional to the square of the diameter.
explanation: Given that the volume of water V is the same for each container and is given by V = (πd²/4) × h, we solve for h to obtain h = (4V)/(πd²). This shows that h is inversely proportional to d². Therefore, as the diameter increases, the height decreases, confirming an inverse relationship.
